item.title: awk command in Linux
item.description: Introduction awk is pattern-directed scanning and processing language. It is useful for doing quick filtering of other commands. This article will show you basic usage of awk and how it can be integrated in daily workflow. Grabbing column(s) from text In this example we’ll grab column(s) from ps command. ps command ps output has 4 columns. ‚ùØ ps PID TTY TIME CMD 608 ttys000 0:00.46 -zsh 613 ttys000 0:00.01 -zsh 797 ttys000 0:00.
